intro: Cordia leslieae, commonly known as the Leslie's hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, woody capsules containing numerous seeds, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
